title: [BUG] [Postman Collections] Header name
description:
Bug Report Checklist

  • Have you provided a full/minimal spec to reproduce the issue?
  • Have you validated the input using an OpenAPI validator (example)?
  • Have you tested with the latest master to confirm the issue still exists?
  • Have you searched for related issues/PRs?
  • What's the actual output vs expected output?
  • [Optional] Sponsorship to speed up the bug fix or feature request (example)
Description

During the generation of a Postman collection the hyphen is removed from the header name, for example, idempotency-key becomes idempotencyKey.
Applying camel-case convention to the header names makes sense for all programming languages, but in Postman's case, the original parameter name should not be modified.

openapi-generator version

7.0.0-SNAPSHOT

OpenAPI declaration file content or url
Steps to reproduce

Generate Postman collection from an OpenAPI file that includes a header using the hyphen

        - description: Custom HTTP header
          name: idempotency-key
          in: header
          schema:
            type: string
Suggest a fix

Modify mustache templates to use baseName CodegenParameter
